titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John P. Robin Papers, 1943-2000 AIS.1977.06
titlestmt.author: Jason Bruegger and Troy Eisenhauer 2012-14.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:14:54 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: John P. Robin Papers

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: John P. Robin, son of Peter and Bessie Robin, was born in Passavant Hospital in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, on October 15, 1912. Robin spent his infancy in the coal mining town of McDonald, Washington County, Pennsylvania, located approximately 20 miles southwest of downtown Pittsburgh. When Robin was three years old his parents moved the family to Pittsburgh and opened a pharmacy at Melwood Street and Centre Avenue in Oakland.

As a student, Robin attended Pittsburgh public schools, eventually graduating from Schenley high school before enrolling to the University of Pittsburgh where he majored in biology. Because of the Great Depression, Robin left school during his senior year prior to graduating. In 1934, Robin secured a job with the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette as a writer; however, his time at the Post-Gazette ended in 1936 when Robin entered into local politics. In November, 1936, Robin went to work as the secretary for Pittsburgh Mayor Cornelius D. Scully. Robin held that position until 1941 when the Mayor Scully appointed him Director of Welfare Activities in the city's Department of Welfare. Robin temporarily left his political career during World War II when he enlisted in the Army, serving from 1943-1945. Upon release from the Army, Robin returned to his hometown of Pittsburgh where in 1946 he was offered the position of Executive Secretary to Mayor David L. Lawrence. That same year the Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) was formed and Robin selected as its first director. Robin would remain Executive Secretary and close confidant to Mayor Lawrence, as well as, serving at the director of the URA. As director, Robin oversaw the development of projects, such as Gateway Center and Point State Park, during Renaissance I. During a nine month stretch in 1955, Robin left Pittsburgh for Harrisburg to join Governor George M. Leader's cabinet as Secretary of Commerce. Robin returned to Pittsburgh in 1957 as president of the Regional Industrial Development Corporation (RIDC). Later that same year, Robin moved to Philadelphia where he served as the Executive Vice President of the Old Philadelphia Development Corporation. While there, Robin oversaw the redevelopment of Society Hill and Independence Mall. In 1963, Robin went to work for the Ford Foundation which relocated him to Calcutta, India. In Calcutta, Robin served as the chief consultant to the Calcutta Metropolitan Planning Organization. In 1967, Robin transferred to Nairobi, Kenya, where he spent three years directing Ford Foundation programs in nine East African Countries. From Nairobi, Robin went on to Athens, Greece, where he worked on a worldwide study of the free world's developing urban centers. In 1973, Robin returned to Pittsburgh as a Professor at the University of Pittsburgh and an advisor to the Allegheny Conference on Community Development. He served as the chairman of the URA board from 1977 to 1994 during Renaissance II while also serving as chairman of the Port Authority. Robin also served as the chairman of the Port Authority Special Task Force, vice chairman of the Allegheny County Planning Commission, county representative of the Southwestern Pennsylvania Regional Planning Commission, the Mayor's Oakland Task Force, and the Mayor's Development Council. John P. Robin died on May 07, 2000, at age 87.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Jason Bruegger and Troy Eisenhauer in 2012-14.

did.unittitle: The Academy for Contemporary Problems

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents pertaining to the economics and future of American cities, and specific regions within the United States. In addition, there is Academy for Contemporary Problems news releases, meeting minutes and agendas, newspaper articles, and professional correspondence documents. There are also documents that specifically pertain to conferences such as the Aspen, Regional Growth Problems in U.S., and the Ohio River-Great Lakes conferences. This series contains documents primarily pertaining to Allegheny County covering topics such as road needs, the neighborhood preservation program, education and teachers, and the Glassport, Bridgeville, Forest Hills, Crafton, and Verona redevelopment projects. In addition, there are Allegheny County Planning Commission meeting minutes and agendas, budgets, multi-year plans/programs, newspaper articles, and professional correspondence documents. There are also airport advisory committee reports, airport zoning committee minutes, and airport southern expressway documents.

did.unittitle: Report of the Panel on Title VII New Communities Program, The Future of the Industrial Midwest, Regional Institutes for Improving the Public Utilization of Technology, Professional correspondence; Bound reports regarding – Revitalizing Central City Investment, The Impact of Inflation of State and Local Government, Revitalizing the Northeastern Economy, Financial relief for trouble cities; Presentation folders containing – Policy Options for Neighborhood Empowerment, Multistate Institutions and Regional Growth Rural Development Issues, Newspaper articles; Loose documents pertaining to – Balanced Growth for the Northeast: Is it Possible?, News releases, Profession correspondence, Managing Urban Transition, The Demographic Future of the Cities of America

New Communities Legislation, Aspen Conference, Conference on Regional Growth Problem, Conference on Ohio River-Great Lakes, National Growth Policy; Bound reports regarding - Proposal for Designing an Economic Development Research Strategy for the Northeastern Region of the United States, Designing an Economic Development Strategy for the Great Lakes Region, The Academy for Contemporary Problems 1976 Annual Report, Financing of County Capital Improvements, A New Administration Mechanism for Allegheny County, The Pittsburgh Civic System: An Overview; Presentation folders containing – Future National Policies Concerning Urban Redevelopment; Loose documents pertaining to – Newspaper articles, Professional correspondence, various meeting agenda and minutes

In addition, there are Allegheny County Planning Commission meeting minutes and agendas, budgets, multi-year plans/programs, newspaper articles, and professional correspondence documents. There are also airport advisory committee reports, airport zoning committee minutes, and airport southern expressway documents.

Citizens Task Force on Refuse Disposal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents pertaining to solid waste and includes reports, articles, and resolutions on solid waste disposal. In addition, there are Citizens Task Force on Refuse Disposal meeting minutes and agendas, newspaper articles, Allegheny County Sanitary Authority annual reports, and professional correspondence documents.

The Ford Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains multiple volumes of the Ford Foundation Letter, annual reports, professional correspondence documents, newspaper articles, various versions of a comprehensive report Robin was involved in preparing concerning urban revitalization in foreign countries, and various papers authored by Robin. In addition, there are documents pertaining to topics, such as urban redevelopment programs, in several countries including Nigeria, Kenya, Argentina, Venezuela, Columbia, Mexico, Pakistan, Peru, Chili, Brazil, Panama, Philippines, Tanzania, Malaysia, Singapore, Turkey, Thailand, Uganda, Zambia, Ghana, India, Calcutta, Bombay, and Lebanon.

Port Authority of Allegheny County

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains Port Authority board packets for both regular meeting and special meeting which contain minutes and agendas. There are staff reports to the board, newspaper articles, PA Transit News publications, professional correspondence documents, proposed operating budgets, monthly financial reports, Port Authority resolutions, Audit and Finance Committee meeting minutes, Consumer Relations Committee meeting minutes, PAT's People Flyer publications, letters from the public, strategic plans, and Planning and Construction Committee minutes and agendas. In addition, there are documents pertaining to specific projects such as the East Busway Feasibility study, South Hills Alternative Analysis study, Commuter Rail, Mon Valley Transit study, Pittsburgh Light Rail, South Hills Light Rail, and airport busway.

University of Pittsburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents pertaining to the Advisory Council of Regional Development (ACORD), the Institute of Politics, and the PITT Benchmark Index Advisory Committee. There are ACROD documents such as meeting minutes and agendas, expense reports, budgets, newspaper articles, and professional correspondence documents. In addition, there are Institute of Politics documents such as meeting minutes and agendas. The Benchmark documents include items such as meeting agendas, newspaper articles, reports, and professional correspondence documents.

did.unittitle: Advisory Council on Regional Development (ACORD) – Professional Correspondence, expense report, and budget; Loose documents pertaining to – Professional Correspondence, Institute of Politics – memorandum, Joint meeting of the board agenda and minutes

Various documents concerning – ACORD and Benchmarks II; Bounds reports regarding – ACORD and Pittsburgh Benchmarks; Loos documents pertaining to – Profession Correspondence, The University's Economic Development Initiatives
Urban Redevelopment Authority

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains Urban Redevelopment Authority meeting minutes and agendas, financial statements, quarterly reports, professional correspondence documents, Executive Committee meeting minutes, Citizens Sponsoring Committee meeting minutes, Mayor Caliguiri speeches, Pittsburgh Cultural Trust District Development Committee meeting minutes and agendas, and Mayor's Task Force on Entertainment Center Development meeting minutes and agendas. In addition, there are documents pertaining to specific projects such as the Convention Center proposal and redevelopment area plan, Lower Hill proposal, Hazelwood proposal, North Side neighborhood revitalization program, North Shore project, Market Square proposal redevelopment area plan, Smallman Street reconstruction project, Herr's Island, YMCA initiative, Buhl Science Center, Parkway East industrial park, Pittsburgh Technology Center, Washington's Landing, Forks of the Ohio National Park, and Schenely Park.

did.unittitle: Bound reports regarding - 601 Liberty, Public Sector Prospectus, Financial Study No. 5 for Public Parking Authority of Pittsburgh, Convention Center Proposal and Redevelopment Area Plan, Lower Hill Proposal and Modification No. 5 to the Plan, Hazelwood Proposal and Modification No. 1 to the Redevelopment Area Plan, Land Use and Housing Plan, City of Charleston, SC, Recommended Priority Highway System Plan, Housing Subsidy Programs, Greenway Revised Proposal and Modification No. 1 to the Redevelopment Area Plan, North Side Neighborhood Revitalization Program Progress Report, Final Technical Report, Penn/Liberty Urban Design Study, North Shore Project Report; Presentation folder; Loose documents pertaining to – Forest City Enterprises Annual Report, Charleston Waterfront Park Master Plan, Pittsburgh Perceived: A Design Image of Pittsburgh

The World Bank

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents pertaining to numerous countries such as Calcutta, Colombia, Iran, Singapore, Thailand, Turkey, Pakistan, Brazil, East Africa, and Jamaica. In addition there are several World Bank Annual Reports.

did.unittitle: The Urbanization Problem in Less Developed Countries report, Urbanization: An Interim Policy Paper, Metropolitanization and National Policies for Growth, Speeches and papers by McNamara and others, Compound and Discounting Tables, Organization Chart, ; Various documents concerning – Calcutta, Columbia, Iran, Singapore, Thailand, Turkey, Morocco, Jamaica, Nigeria, Kenya; Bound reports regarding – World Bank Annual Reports, The Indonesia Economy: Development Trends and Foreign Aid Requirements, Constraints Committee, Professional Correspondence, Report on Bombay
Course on Managing Urban Growth, Tourist maps; various documents concerning – Brazil (in Portuguese)

Various documents concerning – French-Congo, Environmental Studies School (England), Bound reports regarding – British Aid Programme, IFHP Bulletin, Overseas Development Administration, Congo, Educational Workshop: Planning and Building for Development, Several in different languages
Various documents concerning – United Arab Republic, Egypt, Ethiopia, East Africa; Bound reports regarding – Ethiopia
